titles: By the King, a proclamation for preventing the fears and dangers that may arise from the concourse of papists or reputed papists in or near the cities of London or Westminster during this present sitting of Parliament
author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1660-1685 : Charles II)
Charles II, King of England, 1630-1685.
publisher: Printed by the assigns of John Bill and Christopher Barker ...,
notes: "Given at our court at Whitehall the fourteenth day of January, in the five and twentieth year of our reign."
Reproduction of the original in the Huntington Library.
